title: Shielding
body:
Is this still a thing?
"HOW DOES SHIELDING WORK?
Temporary shields will stop players from dropping into a lower tier immediately after promotion. You will be shielded from demotion for the next 3 games after you advance a division. If you advance a tier, you will be shielded for 10 games (3 games for Master Tier). If you are currently being shield and you're in danger of being demoted once the shield wears off, you will receive a warning in your Summoner profile."
Is this still a thing anymore?"
Thanks in advance for an answer

replies.body:
Yup, [shields are still at maximum](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ), Captian. 

https://media.giphy.com/media/2t9sDPrlvFpdK/giphy.gif

Let me know if you have any other questions.
I just got promoted into S5.  I now have 10 game shield, and any game after that losing at 0 LP will cause demotion?

Any loss after hitting 0 LP doesn't *immediately* result in a demotion, but if your Matchmaking Rating (MMR) drops below those in your division, it will mean you are likely to be demoted if you continue to lost matches at 0 LP. Check out our [Ranked Play FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ) for complete details on the ranked system.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
After the shield expires, or MMR overrides the shield?

Hi Targon's Blade, thanks for your contributions to this admittedly older thread. I have had the shield on my d5 account for a long time now; can you clarify what it means? Does it mean that every time I hit 0 lp, the 10 games start again, or does it mean there is a hidden number of safe games that I can lose, depending on how my hidden mmr is? I ask because I tend to go back and forth between 0 - 60 lp a lot, and it always says the same thing, that I am in danger of demotion. But I certainly am losing a lot ( :( ). I guess the best way to phrase it- is it refreshing every time at 0 lp?
